Nathaniel Clyne losing battle to be fit for Premier League opener at Watford, writes @JamesPearceEcho
James Milner should be available for the Watford clash after he returning to full training in Rottach-Egern on Sunday. (James Pearce)

Nathaniel Clyne is a major doubt for the start of the new campaign. He has been hampered by hamstring and back problems. (James Pearce)

Clyne won't be involved in the Audi Cup. The hamstring issue has now cleared up but pain in his back is a continued concern. (James Pearce)

As a result Trent Alexander-Arnold could find himself making only his third top-flight start at Vicarage Road. (James Pearce)
è²·äººå•¦å¥½å—

Loris Karius was back in full training today as Liverpool continued pre-season preparations in Rottach-Egern.

The goalkeeper had missed all of the Reds’ team sessions in the Bavarian town so far due to a hip complaint.

However, Karius rejoined Simon Mingolet and Kamil Grabara in Sunday afternoon’s workout.

Danny Ward, meanwhile, is closing in on a return to training as he continues his rehabilitation from a back issue.
James Milner should be available for the Watford clash after he returning to full training in Rottach-Egern on Sunday. (James Pearce)

Nathaniel Clyne is a major doubt for the start of the new campaign. He has been hampered by hamstring and back problems. (James Pearce)

Clyne won't be involved in the Audi Cup. The hamstring issue has now cleared up but pain in his back is a continued concern. (James Pearce)

As a result Trent Alexander-Arnold could find himself making only his third top-flight start at Vicarage Road. (James Pearce)

Southampton based newspaper the Daily Echo claim that new manager Mauricio Pellegrino is planning for life without captain Virgil van Dijk.

The Dutchman has been forced to train alone at the club’s Staplewood base, while his team-mates have been playing pre-season games in France.

Pellegrino wants to force the 26-year-old to stay, but accepts that he’s not in the right situation, mentally or physically, to begin the season in the team.

As a result, Yoshida and Stephens will be the first-choice centre-back pairing for the opening weekend, claims the report.

Pellegrino hopes to eventually reintegrate van Dijk into the squad upon Southampton’s return from France, but has accepted the fact it may not be possible – with the defender already alerting officials of his plans to depart.

Liverpool, having given up our pursuit of Naby Keita, are desperate to bring in the centre-back, and will be waiting in the wings for the right time to submit an official offer.
